intro: Zea mays var. huehuetenangensis, commonly known as the Mexican maize, is an ancient variety of maize native to Mexico. It is characterized by its tall stature and large, tassel-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, hard grains that are typically used for traditional purposes rather than commercial agriculture. It is considered a valuable genetic resource due to its unique traits and historical significance. Botanically, it exhibits a complex genome and is closely related to other maize varieties.
